intro: Erigeron cilicius, commonly known as the Cyprus fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, including Cyprus, Turkey, and parts of the Middle East. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with ray florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron cilicius is often found in open habitats like cliffs, gravelly soils, and dry meadows.
